remarks: The rank of a set is the supremum of the successors of the ranks of its members.  Exercise 9.1 of [Jech] p. 72.  Also a special case of Theorem 7V(b) of [Enderton] p. 204.  (Contributed by NM, 12-Oct-2003.)
